ptr-5BoBTGfu9H1Dpwwewg.text: Free as a BirdThe food may be priced higher than some nosh from your local kebab shop, but it would be worth cutting short your Saturday night just for once in order to sample the finest brunch in all the land. Your tastebuds will be amazed. Why not stop at the food shop next door on your way home and pretend that you are Jamie Oliver. Try to recreate the Bluebird magic at home. You can even give yourself a Michelin Star.

Neki1JpcgslyQAfmQV7KZQ.text: Was flawless on my last visit. Service was attentive and without fault, they even kept my water glass topped up, a rarity in the UK.

v4jfJGShtkVxOF3viqj_Gw.text: My goodness, this was disgusting. Two of us, their meal came first. 10 minutes later, mine comes and is cold. I ask for it to be heated, and it comes back 20 minutes later... both of us watching the other "eat" (force down food, only out of necessity). Maybe that's their angle, but the accompanying slogan is tough to come up with.

buaTYzQ2bNpxav1yv5QXMQ.text: + things: you can sit outside in these nice lawn seats on their faux-grass / turf and if you stand outside the restaurant, you can see them grilling your food.bad things: service wasn't great, although the food came out fast. menu selection at the cafe isn't huge, do-able, but the restaurant offers a vast range of items (one of which i wanted: chicken soup w/matzoh)the food - small portions, but pretty good food. not super flavorful, fries seemed a bit on the "old oily" oily side. desserts are a must (sorbet trio was great! mango, raspberry to name just some!):: i'd come back again most likely

BYtYSB7Vbx4WUIp7W9eKAQ.text: Come for the great outdoor seating, stay for the people watching.  As others mentioned, the food is mediocre.  We came during Wimbledon so it was fun to watch outside.  Service is lacking a bit as well.

vKjHGQdLLN9AVe167V34fQ.text: A place that has a beautiful architecture and good choices for menu but lacks on charm. Not a bad option but not worthy the £50 per head price tag. Won't be back.

rtL2nDLpohFQ_V8sPHQjaQ.text: I go to the Cafe when I have neither the patience nor the funds to stomach the restaurant upstairs.Plus one for the good solid "this is English food, but not crap English food" menu of roast chicken, burgers, tasty chips, etc. Plus another one for the cute-looking space and decor, including tables on the cobblestones. Plus another one for being near the King's Road (yes, sometimes that could be a GOOD thing depending on the errand one has to run) and not too far from Sloane Square Tube. Plus another one for never making me wait for a table. Plus a half a star for the food, which is not great, but not bad.Minus one because the space is not cute, it's cramped. Even when the retaurant's empty, you're squeezed into a teensy little corner. Minus another one for not having anything on the menu lighter than a burger/half a roast chicken, but more substantial than a green salad. Minus another half because I THOUGHT THIS WAS THE CHEAP ALTERNATIVE TO THE RESTAURANT??? My bill seems to be telling me otherwise.Plus a half because I'm the first to Review. Mwahahaha.

bHdesTVpDlIcaKxM4Ly8JA.text: I've been here for drinks on several occasions and I have throughly enjoyed myself every time. It can be crowded, but service is professional and quick and the drinks are fab. Will definitely return.

6YWAlotTrgV7NN7Wrh_4pA.text: I've eaten here a few times and find it a little chain restaurant style for the price. It always feels a bit rushed too.

Q0MHkpbGsuast09b-w3h2Q.text: Cool place for romantic diner with nice ok food. Pricey for the food but it's all about the atmosphere.Not my typical kind of place, but one of my friends recommended it to me and we weren't disappointed. The building has great history which always triggers interesting discussions. Other than that, well, it's on the Kings road and it can't avoid being posh in places.I also went there for office parties, which is well suited for this kind of events.

1Y2F-SFw8Mp54L_5otuWLQ.text: Bluebird Restaurant is quite a hike from any nearby tube stations so bus is the best option for getting to this restaurant (that is, unless you can afford a chauffer like many of the locals ) We took advantage of a lunch deal on toptable (some set course meal) and it turned out to be very good value for me for the quality of the food that we got and even the portions. I have a big appetite (as all my friend know!) and even I was full after the first two courses (a beautiful velvety and rich mushroom soup and beautifully cooked steak with side of fries.) The restaurant itself is very attractive. The room is gorgeous with high ceilings (so feels particularly light and airy) and funky furniture. Sadly we weren't lucky enough to see any celebs during our dining experience but apparently it is a frequent celeb hangout and I don't blame them. Service was pretty good although strangely they were quite slow with pouring our wine. Wine was hidden away behind our booth in an ice bucket so we never knew how much was left. Great venue.

u6E0ZGWI2dFXt1QCAcpFYA.text: A really lovely little debvelopment, originally set up by Terence Conran, this is a converted 1930s garage that features a restaurant, cafe, foodmarket & private members club. The restaurant delivers the upmarket Modern British food so beloved of Conran, and is of the highest quality (and price). Dishes include Cornish Crab, Lobster, Lamb & Steak. You can eat quite reasonably here, as long as you stick to the cheaper end of the wine list! The dining space is a wonderful 1st floor contemporary space, with views into the kitchen on one side and out onto the Kings Road on the other. For special occaisions hire out the private room, which always reminds me of a James Bond villain control room in the way it overlooks the main restaurant. The Private members club also has rooms for hire. The cafe spills out onto the forecourt in front of the garage and has a very European/pavement cafe feel. The foodmarket serves up some great ingredients too.

9j9xYLlylwh3E-G--Z2__A.text: Wow. What a venue. The stuff of movies and TV - not somewhere I would usually expect to go! We got a meal deal voucher through a website and headed off not knowing what to expect. The place is stunning, pretentious, glamorous and seedy all at once - everything you expect from King's Road!!The food was actually very good, beautifully presented by a very relaxed waiter who didn't make us feel uncomfortable for coming in on a cheapo voucher (some places do). He recommended wine and was great without being overbearing. It's a great place to people watch (and be watched I guess, if you like that kind of thing) and is probably somewhere I would recommend for a special occasion.

0colbBq0MHPiBWrn1zAkSQ.text: I've been here twice - once with my fashionista girlfriend and once solo [on my birthday] and both times the experience was less than pleasing. Stylish? Yes; Good food? No. Good service? Hmmm. The time with my girlfriend, we were in the dining room and a waiter dropped a glass - which broke right behind my chair. Did someone say something? No. Did they rush to pick-it up? No. In fact, it took literally 5-7 minutes before someone came over and swept up the broken glass. How's that for fine dining? The second time was my birthday and I was solo. I had pork and it was just ok. The bar is uncomfortable and the people working there seem to be going through the motions. I haven't been since the D+D folks took over but I'm not expecting much better. There are better dining locations in London, this isn't one of them.

reUBQOVtV5JqcyFc7IgQYw.text: I'm surprised this place has gotten such mediocre reviews from other reviewers. I realize that it may not be the best food in town, but it is a place I'd recommend going at least once if you're ever in the area. I'm giving it four stars for the ambience alone. Some friends and I went here for a late night dinner one night after hearing how posh it was. We just wanted to see what it was all about.  I was not at all disappointed by the atmosphere. Seemed upscale, very young and good-looking crowd. People were dressed nicely. The waiters and hostesses were also dressed nicely and wearing matching outfits, but not in a cheesy way. The dining area is very beautiful and has a nice, contemporary feel.  It did take quite a while for us to be seated for our reservation, so that was one negative thing. They sat us down at the bar to wait. It wasn't terrible, but faster seating could have enhanced the experience.  In terms of the food, it was nothing to rave about. I honestly can't even remember what I ordered, other than a vegetable side dish. I do remember being satisfied by the meal, so I wouldn't say it was disappointing. Overall, very classy, worth a visit.

09SJmd_L8NDJlf0LQFT7oA.text: We had horrible service here over a Christmas party lunch. The food was generally pretty good but for the prices paid (£45 for three courses) the service was inattentive and we were rudely made to leave our table "to reset for dinner" at the end of the afternoon. There are better places to spend your hard earned cash.

RDu-1dV3BZvJfUxClUQ-4Q.text: I came here for a leaving do with some of my colleagues and we had a good meal.  I liked that there was a large outdoor seating area, and the food was a mix of contemporary English food and some standard pub dishes.  Most of the service, like the rest of London, is foreign so its tricky to get quality service.  Overall, I'd come back if I was in the area - but its nothing to go out of your way.  Occasionally there are some celebrity spottings at lunch because its Chelsea.

pdBol-n1bF8TgscbLdQcoQ.text: I came here with a friend after a spot of shopping on the Kings Road. Its got a great location with outside seating, perfect for watching the world go by. We got a really good 2 course deal through top table so it wasn't too expensive either. The food was delicious and after we had a look around the shop they have there which sells a variety of really cool fashion labels.

y9Qu11ExTFwuxIdyakXrFw.text: You need to get there early if you are eating lunch downstairs. The service is a bit iffy but the food is generally quite good and well priced for the Kings Rd. I would recommend going for lunch upstairs and to book through top table who offer a very good price for two courses. It is quite quiet but the service and food are both much better. Parking is not very easy but I still love going there. They also have a lovely shop attached. Incredibly expensive but they have great little things for pressies such as Italian Apricot jam and for a while Mariage des Freres teas.

Wo5Jg-g_Szd_JapGPAiLAQ.text: Bluebird is certainly over rated. The food is very poor, and so is the service. It is also over priced. Saying this, I went a couple of years ago and things may have changed since then. However, my family who have also been there have the same views.

p6vwBqElhVYkaR71sXifBg.text: The food was very good. It's a big space that only works well when nice and full. The refurb a couple of years ago have helped to make this nicer more intimate place. They have introdoced a set menu for £18.50 that certainly seems to be getting people in the door. I had a pear and blue cheese salad which was very nice followed by a duck leg with puy lentils, with a very nice crumble to finish. It seems to be back on form as a restaurant and I would recommend it.

agWG9Xi4WAmZUpP6SzrElw.text: I love the bluebird - it is an institution on the KR. I like the location, the decoration, the outside space... but DO NOT EAT there!! such a waste!! I went for dinner on a tuesday night and the restaurant was empty (probably because all locals have tried and tested and had the same experiance as me). The service was painfully slow... and by the time our food actually came it was horrible. The only thing that saved this from being a complete disaster was the company was excellent!

1g3qMius5dECk2ICZhProw.text: Set meal £25: 3 courses and wine is fantastic value, the mullet and choc cake are great, soup was amazing too. Service was really brilliant and Amex currently giving £10 off if connected to tripadvisor!

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

b8LAGsyJxtGCvUhPPZPWhA.text: Fantastic Chef Matt is brilliant in creatin a never to be forgotten experience every time we go here.Service fantastic

7cpeg31dxDAu3md6GjsGOQ.text: With an extremely promising exterior, I wanted to make this the first meal I would take my friend to when he arrived to London. I expected a high bill, but I also expected super high quality. I definitely received a high bill, but the quality of food was insanely week. I ordered salmon fishcake and wound up with a deep fried ball of mashed potatoes and some ground up salmon within it and about 6 spinach leaves sprinkled on the size. Our house wine was pretty average, and my friend had a bizarre chicken pot pie with all the bits separated.Ambiance on the inside was an investment banker's dream, and it was obnoxiously loud.Go elsewhere for the price. Definitely.

NzFTw9gCC_OqWhjdtUP3yQ.text: Could very well be the most overrated restaurant in London. Greasy mediocre food that harkens back to the bad old days before London's restaurant enlightenment. If you were a fan of the kidney pot pie era of British food, try Bluebird.

i2mbzoX421T-frWULOzp9w.text: Sexy as feck! We went here for work when a VP from the US was in town. The decor is soooooo cool .. very converted warehouse, amazing lights, cool little bar.The food was pricey but not that different from other sexy spots in town 25 squid for a filet steak,  , , ,Food was lush, wine was lush, basically a 'tidy' experience! Only reason it doesnt get 5 stars is we had to wait 15 mins for our first drink ...

r2Vb_qsUcobAYqfO-zlVjQ.text: Went there for a celebratory lunch last week. Given the location (King's Road, Chelsea), it was everything would expect: good (not amazing) food, expensive, elegant (tending towards pretentious) atmosphere and slick (but not necessarily friendly) service. One thing slightly annoyed me: when I asked the waiter's opinion of a couple of the dishes on the menu in the cheaper, £15 range, he tried to up-sell me by advising me to go for a £25 option. As a former waitress, I know up-selling is tempting, but it creates an embarrassing situation for the guest! We had fun: we all enjoyed our meals, but it wasn't really for me. If this sounds like your kind of place, you'll probably love it. If, like me, you're more into street food and local joints with amazing food and a friendly atmosphere, then this is one to avoid. In fact, probably best to avoid Chelsea altogether...

aa-XIDyIlI79NM82DdyokA.text: Went for the Pimm's Cup, and stayed for the BLT. While it's a trendy place where you'd expect the food to be mediocre, it was actually better than expected.

M2et3BsTeztLIYRoBZqTjA.text: A few years back I lived round the corner and never made it to the Restaurant. A welcome opportunity came up to go and have dinner, but did the Restaurant live up to the hype and everything I'd heard about it?It had a lot to live up to but i think on the whole this is a good Restaurant. The food is good quality, the atmosphere is superb and the service is great. No complaints so far. The bill was a little on the steep side for what we had but no more than you would pay in other high end restaurants.What nobody told me about and What i like the most about this place is that it has one of the most superb selection of Vodkas and Gin's I've come across. If you like these spirits you are in for a treat, (i recommend the Hamersmith local Gin!) the staff are well versed in what goes with what and the history of the different brands. They also have a few good looking private function rooms which look great.I'd have given this 3 stars but the excellent bar and atmosphere brings it up to 4. So in summary a hidden gem of a bar with slightly above average food in the restaurant.

MIrdkFXVC1qTxZzBOWVN1A.text: I would not come back here nor would I recommend it. It is overpriced, with a poor atmosphere and very mediocre food. Atmosphere: The place is huge - high ceilings and extravagant decor. You are immediately overwhelmed when you walk in here. It is overly quiet and the service is pretentious (I guess I should expect that from Chelsea!)Food: We had oysters and pasta. The oysters were awful - like I was worried my date might get sick. The pasta was overcooked and the sauce tasted like it was from a can. So sad, especially because both items sounded so great on the menu. Wine & cocktails: These are the reasons why this didn't get only 1 star. I'd come back to hang out at the bar or outside on the terrace in the summer. The cocktails and champagne by the glass are excellent and fun. The wine list itself if overpriced, but extensive. There is so much choice in Chelsea - I'd go elsewhere next time!

prOyK5514OCLnFgAFF_YkA.text: Firstly, it's an amazing room and building this. Really impressive. Huge, round, central bar with a fantastic, oblong chandelier above. It's just by the entrance to the restaurant so it's impressive as you walk in. The decor is fantastic.The bar serves great cocktails. A good start.We reserved a table here throught the Evening Standard deal - 3 courses for £25, including a glass of champers. It's a set menu, which we expected, and the host reminded us, as soon as we were seated, that this was the deal we would be getting. It did feel a little condescending, but maybe I was being sensitive?Ordering out the way, we managed to have ourselves a really fun night in here. It was busy and bustling. The food was decent. I've had muuuuuch better smoked salmon from Sainsbury's, the venison was tasty but small and the dessert I opted for; super-rich.All in all, a pleasant evening and experience. But, as we remarked to each other upon leaving, I would feel disappointed to pay through the nose for the food we had. There is much tastier and better value dining experiences to be had elsewhere.

6JgIXFHwsdOF3X-wS_7VNg.text: This review is based on drinks alone.We went here for my sister-in-law's 30th birthday party. The decor is stunning in this large bar and restaurant, reminiscent of the inside of a beautiful ship.The cocktails were fruity, icy and alcoholic = me likeyHowever they were unnecessarily expensive = me no likeyThe staff were friendly and the area that was reserved for our private party was quite large. My only complaint was that it was also right next to the entrance so there was a lot of other people in the area, not so private.I would love to come back and try the food but judging by other reviews I would do so at my own risk.  When I was there the restaurant was packed and the food looked beautifully presented, so I might still give it a go.

hDA6rf6OyLUpzqXUQ5akNA.text: I only really went to Bluebird when it was on someone else's dime. Because, as most of the other reviewers have said, it's overpriced. BUT, I do really enjoy the cocktails for their inventiveness. The food tasted good but the menu was a bit pretentious. Apart from that, the decor is fantastic and modern, very bold and oversized.

3ScaPE6pc1okcUAPWN2Bhg.text: Came here for afternoon tea for mother's day, disappointed with the service but the quality of afternoon tea was excellent and we did enjoy it but it was spoilt by poor service overall.  We had to wait over 30mins before we were asked if we would like more tea and it was hard to grab their attention and staff were not very attentive. The staffs need to be more organised on these special occasions also the waiters do try and up-sell. Really sad as it spoilt what would have been a lovely afternoon out. I would recommend it as its really nice place & quality is very good. I think though when it gets busy on these special dates, its one to avoid if your limited for time.

EoORWCFqyb46CqlILGJbuw.text: It's a good looking restaurant with good looking people to look at while you're sipping on a few cocktails. A bit on the expensive side, but that's what you get when you're hanging out in the middle of Chelsea. I really love all the cocktails. Especially the jug of cooler you can order while enjoying the sun outside in their fake grass patio. I ate here once, and it's nothing worth mentioning. But If you're looking for good drinks and scene than this place is worth of a visit.

YtAftxFtBevVTn1okDeUJg.text: When in London, I always try to have a night out in Bluebird - the food is very good, the atmosphere and cocktails really clinch it for me.  It's relatively cool, and the cafe downstairs is great for brunch/lunch.   Very very busy spot but still love this place.

4lpDTE7xpq2ICDPMai-e3w.text: Overpriced and not that good frankly. The place is in a good location and looks nice from the outside. The staff are professional and the service is pretty good. However the food is very average and it is expensive. Your paying simply for the name or the Chelsea tag. The bar area is one saving grace and is worth a drink. I'd encourage a cocktail or glass of champagne in the bar, just don't bother eating. Similarly the cafe downstairs is woth having a drink in. A couple of beers in the sun is a ood idea.Don't bother with this place. It's poor VFM and not that nice. There are much better and cheaper restaurants in the area (Cadogan Arms and Pig Ear are two to name).

1bH0wZrV5IOUVCWewLyT4w.text: Food was good, location and surround was great. The staff could be better.

xjUaYukd_rRUGVR2Dm78yA.text: My friend & I originally planned just to catch up in a nice venue which was local to us. I sometimes venture down the Kings Road to browse in my nearest Cath Kidston store, and the Bluebird cafe/restaurant/bar is just a short stroll before this. My friend had been here before and recommended the Bluebird, and I do enjoy trying new places which are local. You first walk through the forecourt which has a number of tables, which is their cafe section - here you can have breakfast & lunch during the day and then dinner & drinks in the evening. I noticed that everyone looked particularly smart, both the men & women. As we met after work and it was getting a little chilly, we decided to head up to the first floor. Immediately you are taken by the chic interior design with lots of reds, we sat around the bar, and as I don't drink they made me an amazing non-alcoholic cocktail. Neither of us had eaten, but we hadn't booked a table, we were however lucky enough to get a table as it was early on in the week. Whilst my friend was eating oysters and seabass, I was particularly unsophisticated and ordered a hamburger which came with chips - simple but tasty :-) I have to say the two people that served us were soo nice, attentive when needed but also left us to it. Dress code: everyone looked smart, which is what you'd expect for somewhere on the fashionable Kings Road. I did however dress smart/casual, teaming my high-waisted skinny jeans with a blouse and pretty bow heels. If you want an alternative place to meet with friends but which is more sophisticated than the local pub, then I'd suggest this. Also, it would make a lovely venue for first dates or couples. I'd definitely go here again.

zeVw07YSZE42I9Wt3tKXFg.text: It feels like a little complex around here - the Bluebird name has been attached to a vaguely pretentious deli, a quite seriously pretentious clothes shop, a not quite pretentious enough café and this, the restaurant. It's a big open place, a little bit brasserie in style with lots of Conran design points in the lighting, tables and stylistics choices.The food is British mostly, with pies, roasts and game featuring fairly prominently on the menu. I had the chicken and mushroom pie when I was in - I think it was about £10 which is quite a bit but I was quite impressed with the quality, the pastry and the accompaniments were spot on. The price goes up a lot when you add more meat and effort to the plate and the roast is just under £20. It's all pricey but say on a Sunday lunch it's cool.

Gjdq0ln9-w21IsS9E2M6EQ.text: I've only been here for cocktails so keep that in mind. The large size of the place was what first caught my eye- then the cool art deco interior. While the drinks are on the pricier side, the service was decent and there was plenty of seating.

rKwHSkp4JnCX4QZcnebbdg.text: I have been here a couple times before and it has never dissapointed. This is always a great place to go, with a big variety on the menu. The cheeseburger is always safe, in fact it's incredible, you must try it. Apart from being quite tricky to get a table if you come for a late lunch it is usually quite easy to get a table for two or four people for a brunch. Brunch is certainly my favourite time to come anyway. A very cool outdoor area with decent service but a great location being in central Chelsea. It is a very fashionable place to eat so I would definitely suggest making the trip there with a small group just to check it out. They make a very good Bloody Mary.

dstRCu7L8Xwav5GSrkAMQw.text: Utterly exasperated at how terrible the service is in here... Brusque, uninterested, slow, condescending. Really, it is that awful.What makes things even worse is that the food isn't even good in order to redeem things. So to summarise: bland, rude, overpriced.Avoid.Avoid.Avoid.

fzl7EssOwJOiEfPMYleFDQ.text: It was an ok meal and the cost was substantial. I wouldn't recommend the place, not because of the cost but of the value, I didn't feel like I was getting that great of food and the atmosphere though nice was riddled with smoking teenagers taking selfies. Just not that upscale of a place. Nice enough for a drink or place to cool your jets for a bit but nothing more.

o1kz4v7wqIQENewn5EnrXQ.text: I would have left fewer stars had the Yelp system allowed for it. I used to live in London years ago and this place used to be amazing. Now, a shell of its former self it's a train wreck. I got the pleasure of waiting 15 minutes for the person to show up to seat me in a wide open patio. Then, once seated, we waited 20 minutes to ever get a waiter to attend to us (of course I had to walk across the patio and nearly slide tackle him). Once we ordered a bottle of champaign and meats, we were promised a bucket of ice for the champaign (which I am still waiting for and not very hopeful now that we are 30 minutes into that empty promise). The low point probably came when the waitress with her blank stare seemed severely challenged with taking our water order. Apparently asking for bottled still water was severely beyond her capabilities. My suggestion, shop in their market and keep walking down the road....better meals lay ahead.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. The brain trust.

-BHLQJajFtbHE6lkno2qGQ.text: My husband made a reservation at Bluebird restaurant October 8th when we were visiting London. After long days of sightseeing and quick, casual dining, Bluebird was the perfect fancy retreat. We arrived in Chelsea early and came in to enjoy funky, floral cocktails at the bar. The high ceilings, eclectic furniture, and lavish flower arrangements were a sight to behold. We were seated promptly when we requested and ordered from the set menu. Everything was perfectly prepared, artfully served, and scrumptious. The food was fresh and seasonal, but not memorable. However, the service, and atmosphere was beyond comparison. I felt like we'd discovered a place where the discriminating Londoners congregate.  I'd love to return and re-live that romantic evening.

nPlmbtqSb714tiH-8KHsIg.text: I was there for a business dinner in a private dining room. The room was nothing special and didn't have the same cool vibe as the bar or main dining room. The service was good and the meal was delicious. Perfectly cooked and seasoned beef and excellent chips which could have been challenging with a group of 25 these are the reasons for my 4. I will definitely go back to see how the rest of the place is!

p55Ar42KhfI4HkC-HUvIVA.text: (This review is for the Cafe at Bluebird) I came here on a late Saturday afternoon and the place was crammed with people. Even though there was a bit of a line to get seated it took under 10 minutes to get a table. The service was a bit slow and my food came out almost 25 minutes after my friends, so luckily we were in no rush.. I had a nice salad with butternut squash and goat cheese which was nice and a good size. After we ate we stayed at the table chatting and drinking for quite a while and even though the place was busy we didn't feel pressured to leave or hurried in anyway. The manager came over at one point and very kindly asked if we would mind moving to another table as he needed ours for a reservation. We happily moved and were pleasantly surprised when the manager sent over a few glasses of free Moët. Nice buzzing atmosphere and beautiful outdoor courtyard. I am eager to go back in the summer when it's sunny and warm.

DlIeh_Wud9YfKxrbe5Ylgw.text: Lovely little place located in charming Chelsea neighborhood in London.  Great little salads and the lunch menu is good. A nice place to spot English celebs.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Inside of Blue Bird Cafe, Chelsea (London)

p8m-cc6C2tMrjAacmF7cyA.text: I had the burger and it was absolutely delicious! Service is a bit slow, we had to ask to order our food and drink but the food is worth it! We sat in the cafe outside, but we had a look at the restaurant upstairs and it looked superb! delicious sounding food and amazing cocktails! But very pricey!

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Bluebird Burger!

0ZGzm4pUaXYjc7CkG5-IXw.text: This review is for the upstairs restaurant only. Honestly, meh. I live close to Bluebird and would always see this place buzzing with lines of fashionable people waiting to get seated. I figured this had to be good and planned to meet a few friends here for dinner. I quickly realized this place is all glitz without much substance behind it.The ambiance is wonderful - we were led to a huge dimly-lit room full of a lot of beautiful people celebrating birthdays, out for a nice dinner, etc. The menu looked appealing enough. While pricey, they had a wide range of selections that were enticing. While I like to get value in my dining experiences, I am always willing to pay a bit more for a great meal, so the price was not necessarily a negative for me. At my group of 4, each and every single one of us were underwhelmed with our meal at every stage (starter, main, and dessert). The food wasn't terrible, but it wasn't great or even good either. Coupled with the hefty price tag that came along with the meal, it just wasn't really worth it. Even in an expensive city like London, I could have gotten a meal that was tenfold more enjoyable for the price I paid at Bluebird. Additionally, the service was slow an unattentive, which is interesting because we didn't sit down to dinner until 9:30, so the restaurant was slowing down. I found myself frustrated at the lags in getting our wine glasses refilled, the delay in the bill presentation, etc. If you're looking for a great meal, I'd say walk past. If you're looking for a trendy scene for some drinks at the bar, this might be okay. Just be warned you will be paying a lot more for what you're getting out of it.

LJCTBV162p-PuB3TkvnMCQ.text: I hadn't been to the Bluebird in years, but finishing a meeting early on a sunny day reminded me of its existence.The location is perfect for enjoying a relaxed lunch outdoors. But that seems to be the only thing going for it these days.The service was the worst I have ever experienced in an upmarket restaurant. We had a total three waiters attending to us, but to very little avail. We completely threw them by asking one of them to wipe our table (covered in crumbs) which resulted in our water order to be taken back to the bar and not be brought back for ages.An embarrassment as I was entertaining a business guest from Germany! I suppose it's not the waiters' fault that the Bluebird Club Sandwich looks like a burger - but why? Tasty enough, though. PS a far cry from a private party I enjoyed here a few years ago

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

jTFMnQ10cOKOQyo1lnwSVw.text: A cheeky little breakfast in Chelsea is never a bad thing! I had the porridge with doubleccream, honey and bananna. It was so delicious I wolfed it down in about 15 seconds! I also had a black American which was nice but too expensive! Your paying for the location here and that irriatates me!

nWGy4YoqlcKplnSMWeZ_RQ.text: The decor and people-watching opportunities are so good, I paid £14 for a champgane cocktail (which was, to be fair, lovely). They film Made in Chelsea here. Make of that what you will.

KBM4bBWXeUso67qljurGhQ.text: You're going here because there is a game on and Bluebird has a great outdoor space for viewing. That's about it, food satisfies but be prepared to wait. You're waiting for awhile and after waiting for a long time the food will taste better than it really is. Is it mind blowing? Nope, but again the game is on, you're hungry and you are outside. Also, you will smell like smoke from the BBQ put outside afterwords.

hSqmPbr10ui_uGOFOMJlvg.text: This is a neighbourhood favourite. My preference is to come for breakfast before the crowd gets there on the weekend. Any time after 10:00 you will be waiting to get a spot. If it's lovely outside the chances of you getting on the terrace will be quite low. Bluebird is a great place to come by yourself for a casual breakfast or with a brunch partner.  My preference is rather simple, poached eggs, toast and the lovely portobello mushrooms.Bluebird is also a one stop shop for all your needs. The coffee shop makes a nice flat white in the mornings to go.Bluebird's upstairs bar and restaurant is a great standby for the area. Cocktails are always well executed and service level in the restaurant is always quite high. Meals have a modern british flair to them.I appreciated living so close to Bluebird as it served a lot of different purposes, I think the key to enjoying it is coming on off peak hours as it is a bit of a tourist/MIC destination.

tzVuhRMYrTse78-VvGstZw.text: Excellent excellent burger in a great setting! Love the open interior design and the food was great! Good atmosphere!

voJhBBf3fvxrUhMVgbgMpg.text: I lorrrrrrrve the bluebird because they make layered cocktails and when I say layered I ain't talking onions or your nans dodgy sponge cake ....Im talking each sip takes you to a different continent ... Smooth,strong and elegant! I had a champagne cocktail the last time I was there .. A pear fizz to be precise ... It was like drinking a whole pear soaked in champagne baby! It did great things for my mind and mouth.. Everyone is professional and the venue is relaxing .... Go go go it's so worth it *flicks hair like models do in l'oreal adverts*

SJSEcK968HEjQ_MLwy6jvQ.text: I love the bluebird, yes they invite me to all the fabulous events but that's not why lol I loveeeee their cocktails....you often end up with drinks that have one single taste....not at the bluebird, the cocktails have multiple layers, dammit the flavours carry you and place you in the clouds with fluffy slippers on. I'd recommend this place for drinks with friends....it's not cheap but they're worth it

dWPy9fVzyKuFxfCUL0Ig_Q.text: A hip location in a interesting location.  The decor is very European for a UK location.  Enjoyed some decent wine and the list is fairly long with an above average selection.  Dinner was solid but not incredible.  The appearance of the restaurant leads you to believe very fine dinning, it's good but the food is not as good as the decor.  Fun people watching at this place so we hung out and kept ordering wine after dinner.  Staff was friendly and provide good service, they were interested in us as we were obviously tourists and getting our drink on.  Dropped some major pounds so we got more attention then the norm from reading other reviews.  I would return

vX4E4hnwqL4Cag3DHs0YBA.text: What a lovely spot!  I took some friends out to dinner here on a night I was in town. It was Sunday and I opted for the tomato soup and fish and chips.  The tomato soup was good and I would order again. The fish and chips was revolutionary and probably the best I've had in my entire life. The batter was so crispy and delicious that they must have double fried it or simply dusted it with a bit of heaven.  Wow!  I can't wait to go again!

8wvv6Ot6k_NdC8yrQFjaqg.text: This review is based on me going one time, only for drinks, and not sitting outside. So you can judge this review based on that... mmmmmk?This place is filled with silly people. You know, the type of Chelsean's who go to spend a lot of money and look good and judge everyone else? It's kind of funny because I feel like I'm starting to write a lot of judgy reviews, but it is my choice to come to these places. WHATEVER I'm getting distracted. I think I'm going through a cocktail phase where I think it's really fun to just try a bunch of cocktails. To be honest with you, all of the cocktails I tried (which was 8 because we are only friends with people who like to share ;) ) were absolutely delicious. And that's saying something!!! They were all really different and beautiful. I especially dug the lychee and rose martini. So, if you're into cocktails, and don't mind spending some dough (no they're not cheap, you're in Chelsea so you can't complain about the price), then come here!Not gonna lie, I'd love to check out this place during the day because everyone talks about sitting outside on their pretty patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Pisco memories- yum!
Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Lychee and rose martini- yum

3xkahB1_fQw9XLzn0-Rjrg.text: I would say I'm somewhat neutral on Bluebird. While they have a really nice patio and lovely interior you are walking right into the core Chelsea crowd. If you like that and are ok with that vibe then it's a decent place either for a meal or for drinks. I've had only booze there and it was a decent experience at a King's Road price.

_K-_tMHCO8Sj3Bl7f8D4Wg.text: Pricey, trendy, cool ambiance and a very big space. Food was pretty good and service is attentive. I quite enjoyed my artichoke rigatoni and olives snack. Honestly it's a perfectly good restaurant if you're in the hood, nothing wrong with it!

XEsFRad6KxG3xMk-qumEGA.text: Nice food, lots of spaces for intimate dining at this London Favorite

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Very busy after work crowd

-ndtpcReIy9-pvTsLox9tQ.text: My friend and I happened upon Bluebird while wondering around Chelsea. The café area is a perfect place to enjoy lunch on a sunny day. Seating outside includes couches, tables, or at the bar. Various flowers and greenery help give the place a garden party vibe. The menu for the cafe area is simple, but allows you to enjoy a lighter meal as well as a glass (or two) of beer or wine. For my meal, I chose the Croque Monsieur, a sandwich with ham and adorned with melted emmental cheese on top, paired with a salad and fries. The sandwhich was so good, especially after a morning of sightseeing that built up an appetite. Paired with a glass of one of their red wines, this was a perfect place to unwind and relax.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

B5KtoevcYLmMh1OCf0LEAw.text: We went to Bluebird for my birthday and the occasion very enjoyable. The atmosphere is buzzy, the food is very good and the setting was intimate but social. Getting there half an hour early meant we had time for a drink at the bar. Great atmosphere, very dim lighting throughout and stylish interior. Ordered two very well made cocktails. Our table was first set right next to the till (and all the coming and going wait staff). We asked to move which involved setting up another table which was done quickly and without issue. The food: scallops, yellowfin tuna tartare and steak for two. The starters were delicious, mainly the scallop dish but the tuna was perfectly nice. Steak was stunning, we devoured it. The bottle of wine we ordered was outstanding and would go back just to have a glass. Would recommend for a trendy, delicious dinner option.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Tortilla chip with guacamole dip
Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Hummus dip
Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Sort shell crab sandwich (20 but worth it)!

LBnlribY0exgzUWm-d6cFA.text: OK food, not that great of service.  Great drink menu.This is definitely a fun hang out place; the crowd was young, hip, talking and enjoying the great drinks.  I would love to come back here with the girls, but I would not recommend it for general dinner.

9dIiWnDK8NECrpqM4aNC1g.text: I had lunch here and really enjoyed it. The location and atmosphere were really pleasant as were the waitresses. I had the fried baby squid, chilli & lime for starter and the grilled yellowfin tuna with cauliflower tabbouleh for main.The fried squid was delectable! I would go back just to order two servings of this. The yellowfin tuna was also good.Great spot for lunch and would love to come back in warmer weather to sit outside with some drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Fried baby squid (7.50)

I6CXq4Rh64qyIl7dGcnIdQ.text: We went to watch Wimbledon and get drinks at Bluebird. Amazing screen to view the games. The drinks were very well made and the ceviche and shrimp tempura were also amazing. It is a little pricey, but its justified because of the amazing location of the place. Service was a little slow because of all the people that had come to view the game as-well. But overall a great place to hang out and get some drinks.

mE1DK6h_PyyVX3vYvs6AjA.text: Just went in for a drink at the bar. Very pretty botanical interior.We Ordered:1. The Botanist: Sparkling cocktail with Gin, fresh passion fruit puree, rosemary, campari, watermelon syrup, topped with sparkling wine! This drink was delicious and  i would get it again and again!

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. The botanist

xX6zP5Vtix5AeNbNMecN8w.text: I ate here with my parents on our recent trip to London. We ate here on our first night as it was close to the place we were staying and I'd read good reviews. This ended up being our least favorite meal of the entire trip and I would not recommend the restaurant.We arrived for our 6:00 PM reservation and was told the table was not ready! Crazy as the place was pretty much empty except for patrons at the bar. So, we ordered up a couple of glasses of champagne while we waited.The restaurant is fairly large with an open plan and the decor was somewhat odd. The waitstaff and wine steward were friendly and knowledgeable, but we felt that the service was rushed.We started with the Buratta, which was divine, and the 24 months prosciutto, which had a delicious packed quince sauce. My Mom had the handmade gnocchi and loved them, while my Dad ventured out and ordered the Grilled calf's liver, which he said was divine. I went out on a limb and ordered the mackerel, a fish I'd never eaten before. It was salty and flavorful.Overall, I'd give the food high marks but wouldn't go back due to poor service and atmosphere. I think it would be a better place to go for drinks and appetizers when the weather is warm and you can sit outside.

RSJFrWk-gdYma8t8G4ZpmA.text: Went here for our last big night in London with the family and found it very satisfying. Quick disclaimer - my cousin and her hubs both loved this place as it was the site of one of their first date location, but were slightly disappointed in our experience.The food was delish. I ordered the salmon and started with the heirloom tomato salad. The burata in the salad was some of the best I've had! The salmon was good - very tender but the sauce with it was a little bitter for my taste. The boys split the steak and allowed me to steal a bite. It was so tender and melted in my mouth. I wish I would have ordered it!The service was only so-so. The servers seemed irritated when we asked for more water and ketchup - super silly things I know. The room was also extremely hot. We requested that they turn up the AC and they seemed bothered with this as well. I assumed that as a nice, relatively expensive restaurant, asking for this shouldn't be a huge deal.Despite this though, I'm sure my cousin will go back. It might not be my first choice if/when I'm back in London.

Dv5DAWKM8DJ9LFSJ4bolmg.text: An elegant, upscale brunch place which is literally the spitting image of what I'd create like if I had the money, skill, and any kind of talent  or eye for design. The art deco, white building set back against the King's Road of Chelsea is a beautiful dining experience. It's definitely where you would take your fiance's parents or a long courted girlfriend. It makes for a 'dress-up' fancy brunch out with the girls to eat up not only the the Anglo-French menu but the airy, splendidly grand structure of the interior.Menu items are typical of brunch, with eggs served up in fancy ways and the lunch menu appeared to be fairly standard as well. What you wouldn't expect is all the little extras of the cafe, such as wine cellar boasting 750 bottles of vino and the adorable shop where you can buy your favorites to take home with you. The cocktail list here is actually impressively long - perfect for a boozy afternoon. There is an outdoor courtyard and the afternoon tea area as well.Amid stunning presentation of the food, the thing that didn't make me fall instantly in love with it, is that the food seemed to be missing some of the finesse I would expect of an established brunch haven of Bluebird's fame. The side salads were not quite there, small and with the dressing being thin and meek. The eggs royale were fine, of course, but nothing to take them over the edge of everyday eggs royale anywhere. I had similar comments from the other guests are our table in regards to the salmon as well. I will definitely be returning, but perhaps for cocktails or afternoon tea (or both).

MAYbxDaXh3yyI1_qUkkTHQ.text: I came here for a Sunday brunch. It was a fair deal at 25 pounds for two courses - I ordered the chili fried squid as my starter and the pork belly with a lentil stew as my main. It was a very good ambiance- and drinks were expensive to match. Portion size was sufficient and not stingy. Overall a good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

K5zMxkNWsmBo7rDUkZ7dpw.text: I booked a table at Bluebird for dinner through OpenTable because of my love for Made in Chelsea having seen it so many times on the show. It was perfect. It's huuuuge! There's a cafe section, a huge outdoor bar area and a massive restaurant with another circular bar which you can sit at. All the staff were so friendly, sweet and attentive, I felt happy and relaxed the whole evening. We got a fantastic deal of 2 courses with a glass of wine for £20 from the set menu. The food really surprised me it was excellent! I had a pea risotto which was a huge portion and really cheesy and tasty! For pudding, as I have a nut allergy and was a little limited I was able to choose from the a la carte menu for no extra charge. I had a wonderful Chelsea evening here, it was exactly as I had hoped =] Will be coming back here fo sho!

SzSIRKSB70cNX0BnOChabg.text: So Chelsea is close by and we haven't explored the area much and decided to head here for dinner and drinks. We were totally undecided on the venue and just decided to walk down King's Road and pick. We both were drawn to walk into Bluebird Chelsea. The cafe is cosy and quiet. I am sure it makes for a beautiful summer evening out. I will go back here just for the prawns with chili miso glaze....magic...pure magic. For mains I had the southern fried chicken and the husband had mussels. Both were really good! I couldn't finish my chicken though. There was some good red wine to go with it. I know white would be a better pairing with our food choice..but it was a cold evening...and we both prefer red.Staff is nice, service is quick. Ambiance as I said is good. Best to finish an early meal here and head to the Bluebird Chelsea Bar upstairs.

rdpxXsjdr4Je4z0csBSNZQ.text: Super close quarters inside but it's got a nice vibe. Avocado toast was just okay. It was hard to get our server's attention. The surrounding Bluebird shops are really cute (and expensive).

wze1hmm0ZwoX-vhZa06-fQ.text: I echo other reviewers' comments in the quality of the food. We had three dishes and all three were bland and nothing that I would pay Bluebird prices for. Service, however, was attentive and the atmosphere was nice. Game terrine - bland. Toast was hard as a rock. Pan roasted plaice - felt like it was more bones than meat on the fish. Spinach was soaked in oil. Flourless chocolate cake - inconsistent as parts were dry and others were moist.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Flourless chocolate cake

WuGNG2n__GB-k8agQaLCyA.text: Awesome Bloody Mary's! We had eggs Benedict which were average and arrived long before our drinks. Service wasn't the best. This is a trendy spot. You can sit outside in the courtyard, go to the cafe or to the restaurant inside.I will be back to experience Blue Bird for dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict

NEgJ71QGNE6F_NTB-KRfXg.text: Reading the reviews, I'm not surprised that this place only has 3 stars. I booked for a Sunday lunch with friends, which puts you in the upstairs restaurant that was nearly deserted. The downstairs front garden area is the place to be and attracts a queue, but I don't think you can book for that. On the other hand, I think Bluebird is one of the better known places on King's Road, and the decor is very upscale and classy. So the type of brunch you would put on makeup and a nice dress for, not like shorts and flip flops.When we got to the table, a few of our friends were running late so we tried to order mimosas... the waitress didn't know what a mimosa was, but she suggested the cocktail menu, and before we knew it, we had a long list of champagne cocktails to choose from. I got the Flirtini and it was delicious, and my friend got the Tiffany Rose and said that was great too. They're not cheap and will cost you more than your meal, but champagne is always fun for brunch.For my main, I got the burger because I had seen it on the blackboard outside the restaurant, and I was very disappointed. There was nothing special about it, and I even felt that it was underseasoned, as the meat had no flavor. I got the polenta chips as a side instead of normal chips, and those were oversalted but at least unique. They also messed up my friends' eggs benedict and eggs royale orders, as they asked for the sauce on the side and when it came with sauce poured all over it, we had to send it back. Luckily the replacement came within 5 minutes.Overall I'd say the food was a letdown, but the decor and the drinks make this place worth going. And next time I'd love to try the garden area and stick around to peek around the shop and the bakery. The whole place is beautiful, just wish the kitchen could keep up!
